Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should subsidize space exploration", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: We should subsidize space exploration as we have learnt a lot and can advance through technology<sep>Keypoint: Space exploration can help in colonizing the resources/lands of other planets
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that we should subsidize space exploration as we have learnt a lot and can advance through technology

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Space exploration advances the frontiers of mankind, and could well discover new resources that will be invaluable due to the depletion of those on earth.<sep>Keypoint: Space exploration can help in colonizing the resources/lands of other planets
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that space exploration advances the frontiers of mankind, and could well discover new resources that will be invaluable due to the depletion of those on earth.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: We should because we can still learn so much about space.<sep>Keypoint: Space exploration unravels information about the universe
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that we should because we can still learn so much about space.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Space exploration is a vastly costly exercise that would drain much needed finances for other more worthwhile projects if it were subsidised.<sep>Keypoint: There are issues more important to fund than space exploration
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that space exploration is a vastly costly exercise that would drain much needed finances for other more worthwhile projects if it were subsidised.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: We should not subsidize space exploration because the money should be used for more important things like medical research<sep>Keypoint: Space exploration can be carried by the private sector
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that we should not subsidize space exploration because the money should be used for more important things like medical research

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Space exploration is essential to lead the way into discovering new technologies and it also leads to countries co-operating with each other on an international level.<sep>Keypoint: Space exploration can help in colonizing the resources/lands of other planets
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that space exploration is essential to lead the way into discovering new technologies and it also leads to countries co-operating with each other on an international level.
